  • Help

All Classes and Interfaces

Classes
Class
Description
AbstractGameScreen
Abstract base class for game screens, implementing common functionality for rendering, screen management, and user input handling.
Arrow
Represents a navigational arrow that points to the nearest door in the maze.
CollectibleItem
Abstract base class for collectible items in the maze game.
DesktopLauncher
The DesktopLauncher class is the entry point for the desktop version of the Maze Runner game.
Door
Represents a door in the maze that can be opened when specific conditions are met.
Friends
Manages the "friends" in the maze game.
GameClearScreen
Represents the screen displayed when the player successfully completes the game.
GameOverScreen
Represents the screen displayed when the player loses the game.
GameScreen
The GameScreen class is responsible for rendering the gameplay screen.
Griever
The Griever class represents an enemy character (Griever) in the maze.
HUD
The HUD (Heads-Up Display) class manages and renders the game's user interface elements.
Item
The Item class represents a collectible item in the game.
Key
The Key class represents a collectible key in the game.
MazeRunnerGame
The MazeRunnerGame class represents the core of the Maze Runner game.
MenuScreen
The MenuScreen class is responsible for displaying the main menu of the game.
Player
The Player class represents the player character in the game, including its movement, animation, collision detection, state management (e.g., speed boosts), and rendering.
SoundManager
Manages all sound and music assets for the game, including background music, sound effects, and their playback.
Trap
Represents a trap in the game, which includes a rock that falls when a player is nearby.
TrapItem
The TrapItem class represents a collectible item in the game that triggers a special trap effect, such as a fog effect, when collected by the player.
Wall
Represents a moving wall in the game maze that can interact with player, friends and grievers.
